intro: Spermacoce poaya, commonly known as the Brazilian star apple, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn yellow or orange when mature. The fruit contains a single seed enclosed in a fleshy, edible pulp. It is often grown for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
